message:
Alsalam Alykom 
I working in MVC Project EF , I have Model and ViewModel .there is AutoMapper between them .should i implement "Custom Validation" in Model or view model? what is the best way ?

data.message: u can use custom attributes to enable validation in the backend model .. w b3den fl frontend t3mli validation motwafk m3 el business bta3k fl backend .. ana kont 3mltha mra bl custom attributes

I usually use the onion architecture and like to leave the core model without any dependencies. This will not be the case if you implement validation in your model. In this case you will need to add the DataAnnotation namespace to your model.

If you mean by validation= ui validation, then it should be done in presentation layer= in your view model. Using data annotation attributes will be good here.
If you mean by validation= business rules= it should be done elsewhere depending on the complexity of your application. For most cases, using poco models+ business rules on service layer would be sufficient.
